description.narrative: Free Press Unlimiteds projekt kommer att stärka olika media aktörer och institutioner i Syrien. Visionen är att kunna bidra till en demokratisering av ett framtida Syrien. En allians av syriska org kommer att etableras och projektet fokuserar på att stärka dessa nya organisationer med org utveckling så att projektet leder till hållbara resultat samt erbjuda kap. utv. till fler media aktörer.

The project aims to support and strengthen the Syrian media to become autonomous and independent by establishing Ethical Journalism for Syria Alliance with 6 Syrian organizations. Through the alliance, the project will build the capacity of different media players. The project also focuses on strengthening the 6 new Syrian organizations, with org capacity to sustain the result of the project.

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Under the support period, FPU has reached good results despite the difficult context they are operating in. The conflict in Syria has been escalating during the activity period with very high levels of violence and an increased number of involved actors at all levels of the conflict. Moreover, civil society in the region is negatively affected by a shrinking space, not least in Turkey where FPU have been implementing significant parts of the activities. In spite of these challenges, FPU has, with a flexible approach, managed to achieve the intended outcomes with only a few, minor deviations.
As a result of FPU's programme, an alliance of Syrian media organisations (EJSA) has been created under an Ethical Charter with the aim to foster and defend free speech. The text of the Ethical Charter have been formulated, agreed upon and officially launched and signed by 40 media organisations. The Ethical Charter for Syrian Media (ECSM) was set up as an organisation to lead the expansion and adherence to the Ethical Charter and to function as a press council for Syrian media. ECSM promotes and defends free speech and professional journalism among its more than 30 members.
FPU has also contributed to building professional and institutional capacity among its partners to enforce the Ethical Journalism alliance’s code-of-ethics, developing a mechanism for monitoring and documenting violations, and providing journalistic training to the alliance’s members, both through basic and advanced training sessions on issues such as multimedia, editing, basic journalism, personal Health, safety, and ICT security. Trainings have been tailored to the needs of the individual organisations and the participants have increased their professionalism compared with the start of the programme. All media partners have also considerably increased their (online) audience. The media content monitoring team has produced a total of 200 reports that have been used by FPU and media partners for assessing and improving the partners' work. Moreover, FPU has contributed to promote sustainability of EJSA and its members by coaching their management teams on project/financial management, monitoring/reporting and long-term business plans. Gender mainstreaming has been an integral part of the implemented activities.
On a more overall level, FPU has also managed to bring the Syrian media sector closer together, not only through the forming of an alliance, but also through the provision of networking opportunities such as partner conferences and workshops. FPU has also focused on creating awareness on different aspects of security as well as gender equality among its partners and has managed to increase their partners' understanding for the importance of gender-balanced reporting.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
